verbose_text: We find HS and its sulphation by Hs2st and Hs6st1 are essential for the normal formation and maintenance of a steady-state [Fgf8] gradient, because removing HS altogether (heparanase experiment) or leaving HS intact but losing the function of different HS modifying enzymes (Hs2st -/- and Hs6st1 -/- experiments) all caused significant fluctuations in the gradient amplitude (amount of Fgf8 in the gradient) through time that were not observed in WT cultures.
